TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi beforefieldinit FontTypeConverter extends System.ComponentModel.ExpandableObjectConverter

Docs.summary: Provides type converters for converting objects to and from objects of other types.

remarks.format:
## Remarks As implemented in this class, this method returns `true` only if `sourceType` is <xref:System.Uri>.
The `context` parameter is not used. See Notes for Inheritors.

block.para: Override this method to provide your own conversion requirements. Use the parameter to extract additional information about the environment from which this converter is invoked. Docs.param: An object that provides contextual information.
The language and culture that are used during the conversion.
The object you want to convert.
The type that you want converted to.
Docs.summary: Converts a to an object of the specified type.
Docs.returns: The new of the designated type. As implemented in this class, this must be a . It expresses the [!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_uri](~/includes/tlasharptla-uri-md.md)] of the font subset that is used by the parameter.

remarks.format:
## Remarks As implemented in this class, `value` must be a <xref:System.Windows.Media.GlyphRun>.
As implemented in this class, `destinationType` must be a <xref:System.Uri> or the <xref:System.NotSupportedException> is thrown.
The `culture` parameter is not used. See Notes for Inheritors.

Docs.exception: The is not a type that can be converted to.
An error occurs when serializing the glyph run.

block.para: Override this method to provide your own conversion. Use the parameter to specify the language and culture. Use the parameter to extract additional information about the environment from which this converter is invoked. This parameter can be ; therefore, always check it. Also, properties on the object can return a null reference ().
